cyclone.name: CHRIS
cyclone.current_location: about 230 mi SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting north-northwest, expected to meander well offshore of the North Carolina coast through the weekend, then turn northeast and move farther out into the Atlantic early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall expected (forecast to remain offshore)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mainly the offshore waters and Outer Banks of North Carolina; some marine impacts possible along the Virginia and mid-Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (â‰¤33%) of tropical-storm-force gusts (39-46 mph) beginning late Sunday and persisting into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally <3 ft) possible during high tides along the lower Chesapeake and Virginia Beach if on-shore flow persists.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1-3 in of rain; localized heavier showers possible but widespread 4 in totals are not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas could disrupt pilotage and small-craft operations near the harbor entrance.
